Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    play.test.FakeRequest
    construct a Request using play.mvc.Http.RequestBuilder
    play.mvc.WebSocket.Out
    Use Akka Streams instead.
    play.libs.ws.WSRequestHolder
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    play.db.DB
    Use play.api.Database
    play.libs.F.Promise
    Use the JDK8 CompletionStage instead. When migrating to CompletionStage, Promise implements CompletionStage, so it may be easier to first migrate all the existing method calls on the promise, such as map/flatMap, which are also deprecated but include migration instructions in the deprecation message.
    play.libs.F.RedeemablePromise
    Use CompletableFuture instead.
    play.GlobalSettings
    This class is deprecated in 2.5.0. Please use dependency injection in preference to GlobalSettings.
    play.mvc.LegacyWebSocket
    Use play.mvc.WebSocket instead.
    play.db.ebean.Model
    Use com.avaje.ebean.Model instead.
    play.libs.ws.ning.NingWSClient
    Use AhcWSClient instead
    play.mvc.Results.ByteChunks
    use Source instead.
    play.mvc.Results.Chunks
    use Source instead.
    play.mvc.Results.StringChunks
    use Source instead.
    play.mvc.WebSocket.In
    Use Akka Streams instead.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    play.Play.application()
    inject the Application instead
    play.mvc.Results.badRequest(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.badRequest() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.mvc.StatusHeader.chunked(Results.Chunks<T>)
    Use StatusHeader.chunked(Source) instead.
    play.libs.ws.WS.client()
    Please use a WSClient instance using DI (since 2.5)
    play.mvc.Results.created(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.created() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.delayed(Supplier<A>, long, TimeUnit)
    Use Futures.delayed(Supplier, long, TimeUnit, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.delayed(Supplier<A>, long, TimeUnit, ExecutionContext)
    Use Futures.delayed(Supplier, long, TimeUnit, Executor) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.fallbackTo(F.Promise<A>)
    Use F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction) followed by F.Promise.thenCompose(Function) with the identity function.
    play.libs.F.Promise.filter(Predicate<? super A>)
    Use F.Promise.thenApplyAsync(Function, Executor) to implement the filter manually.
    play.libs.F.Promise.filter(Predicate<? super A>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.thenApplyAsync(Function, Executor) to implement the filter manually.
    play.libs.F.Promise.flatMap(Function<? super A, ? extends CompletionStage<B>>)
    Use F.Promise.thenComposeAsync(Function, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() if you want to capture the current context.
    play.libs.F.Promise.flatMap(Function<? super A, ? extends CompletionStage<B>>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.thenComposeAsync(Function, Executor).
    play.mvc.Results.forbidden(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.forbidden() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.get(long)
    Calling get on a promise is a blocking operation and so introduces the risk of deadlocks and has serious performance implications.
    play.libs.F.Promise.get(long, TimeUnit)
    Calling get on a promise is a blocking operation and so introduces the risk of deadlocks and has serious performance implications.
    play.mvc.Results.internalServerError(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.internalServerError() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.Play.isDev()
    inject the Environment instead
    play.Play.isProd()
    inject the Environment instead
    play.Play.isTest()
    inject the Environment instead
    play.libs.F.Promise.map(Function<? super A, ? extends B>)
    Use F.Promise.thenApplyAsync(Function, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() if you want to capture the current context.
    play.libs.F.Promise.map(Function<? super A, ? extends B>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.thenApplyAsync(Function, Executor)
    play.Play.mode()
    inject the Environment instead
    play.mvc.Results.notFound(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.notFound() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.mvc.Results.ok(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.ok() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.onFailure(Consumer<Throwable>)
    Use F.Promise.whenCompleteAsync(BiConsumer, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() if you want to capture the current context.
    play.libs.F.Promise.onFailure(Consumer<Throwable>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.whenCompleteAsync(BiConsumer, Executor).
    play.libs.F.Promise.onRedeem(Consumer<? super A>)
    Use F.Promise.thenAcceptAsync(Consumer, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.onRedeem(Consumer<? super A>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.thenAcceptAsync(Consumer, Executor) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.or(F.Promise<B>)
    Use F.Promise.applyToEither(CompletionStage, Function) instead.
    play.mvc.Results.paymentRequired(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.paymentRequired() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.promise(Supplier<A>)
    Use CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier, Executor) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.promise(Supplier<A>, ExecutionContext)
    Use CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier, Executor) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.pure(A)
    Use CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.recover(Function<Throwable, ? extends A>)
    Use F.Promise.exceptionally(Function) if you don't need the current context captured, or F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() if you do.
    play.libs.F.Promise.recover(Function<Throwable, ? extends A>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction, Executor) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.recoverWith(Function<Throwable, ? extends CompletionStage<A>>)
    Use F.Promise.exceptionally(Function) if you don't need the current context captured, or F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction, Executor) with HttpExecution.defaultContext() if you do, then use F.Promise.thenCompose(Function) with the identity function to flatten the result.
    play.libs.F.Promise.recoverWith(Function<Throwable, F.Promise<A>>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction, Executor) instead, followed by F.Promise.thenCompose(Function) with the identity function.
    play.mvc.WebSocket.reject(Result)
    Use the WebSocket.accept*OrResult methods instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.sequence(ExecutionContext, F.Promise<A>...)
    Use Futures.sequence(CompletionStage[]) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.sequence(F.Promise<A>...)
    Use Futures.sequence(CompletionStage[]) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.sequence(Iterable<F.Promise<A>>)
    Use Futures.sequence(Iterable) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.sequence(Iterable<F.Promise<A>>, ExecutionContext)
    Use Futures.sequence(Iterable) instead.
    play.libs.ws.WSRequest.setBody(InputStream)
    use WSRequest.setBody(Source) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Response.setContentType(String)
    noop. Use Result.as(String) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Response.setCookie(String, String)
    Use Http.Response.setCookie(Http.Cookie) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Response.setCookie(String, String, Integer)
    Use Http.Response.setCookie(Http.Cookie) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Response.setCookie(String, String, Integer, String)
    Use Http.Response.setCookie(Http.Cookie) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Response.setCookie(String, String, Integer, String, String)
    Use Http.Response.setCookie(Http.Cookie) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Response.setCookie(String, String, Integer, String, String, boolean, boolean)
    Use Http.Response.setCookie(Http.Cookie) instead.
    play.mvc.Http.Request.setUsername(String)
    As of release 2.4, use Http.Request.withUsername(java.lang.String)
    play.libs.F.Promise.throwing(Throwable)
    Construct a new CompletableFuture and use CompletableFuture.completeExceptionally(Throwable) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.timeout(A, long)
    Use Futures.timeout(Object, long, TimeUnit) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.timeout(A, long, TimeUnit)
    Use Futures.timeout(Object, long, TimeUnit) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.timeout(long)
    Use Futures.timeout(long, TimeUnit) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.timeout(long, TimeUnit)
    Use Futures.timeout(long, TimeUnit) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.transform(Function<? super A, ? extends B>, Function<Throwable, Throwable>)
    Use F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction, Executor) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.transform(Function<? super A, ? extends B>, Function<Throwable, Throwable>, ExecutionContext)
    Use F.Promise.handleAsync(BiFunction, Executor) instead.
    play.mvc.Results.unauthorized(Results.Chunks<?>)
    Use Results.unauthorized() with StatusHeader.chunked(akka.stream.javadsl.Source) instead.
    play.libs.ws.WS.url(String)
    Please use a WSClient instance using DI (since 2.5)
    play.mvc.WebSocket.whenReady(BiConsumer<WebSocket.In<A>, WebSocket.Out<A>>)
    Use the WebSocket.accept* methods instead.
    play.mvc.WebSocket.withActor(Function<ActorRef, Props>)
    Use the WebSocket.accept* methods instead, with a flow created by wrapping a Sink.actorRef and Source.actorRef.
    play.db.jpa.DefaultJPAApi.withTransactionAsync(String, boolean, Supplier<F.Promise<T>>)
    This may cause deadlocks
    play.db.jpa.JPA.withTransactionAsync(String, boolean, Supplier<F.Promise<T>>)
    This may cause deadlocks
    play.db.jpa.JPAApi.withTransactionAsync(String, boolean, Supplier<F.Promise<T>>)
    This may cause deadlocks
    play.db.jpa.DefaultJPAApi.withTransactionAsync(Supplier<F.Promise<T>>)
    This may cause deadlocks
    play.db.jpa.JPA.withTransactionAsync(Supplier<F.Promise<T>>)
    This may cause deadlocks
    play.db.jpa.JPAApi.withTransactionAsync(Supplier<F.Promise<T>>)
    This may cause deadlocks
    play.libs.F.Promise.wrap(Future<A>)
    Use FutureConverters.toJava(Future) instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.wrapped()
    Promise no longer wraps a Scala Future, use asScala instead.
    play.libs.F.Promise.zip(CompletionStage<B>)
    Use F.Promise.thenCombine(CompletionStage, BiFunction) instead.
